repnme.cdata!: Peru - Debt and Debt Service Reduction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as highly satisfactory. The long process leading up to
            Peru's Debt and Debt Service Reduction operation
            reconfirms 1) the costliness to an economy of breaking its
            links to the international economy and adopting a
            go-it-alone strategy; and 2) that success in reestablishing
            international creditworthiness ultimately depends on the
            quality of the country's macroeconomic management and
            reforms. While the Bank and the other International
            Financial Institutions (IFIs) can play an important
            catalytic roles, as they did in Peruvian case, the quality
            of the country's own program and will to implement it
            are the decisive elements in making the operation successful.

repnme.cdata!:
Peru - Debt and Debt Service Reduction Loan
            and Related Measures to Support the Debt Reduction Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Debt and Debt
            Service Reduction Loan Project is to support the
            implementation of the Debt and Debt Service Reduction (DDSR)
            loan. The DDSR will alleviate market uncertainty over
            Peru's capacity and willingness to service its debt by:
            a) eliminating Peru's arrears and normalizing its
            relations with commercial creditors; b) reducing the present
            value of debt service payments; c) shielding commercial
            interest obligations from interest rate risk; and d)
            transforming commercial loans into bonds. The loan will be
            used to help finance the up-front costs of the DDSR agreement.
